summary: This is a service request record from Signet Technologies regarding the relocation and reconfiguration of recorders and AMS (likely Automated Monitoring Systems) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York. The request was initiated by the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) for the MCC New York location at 150 Park Row, and assigned to technicians Jeff Cranor, Jeff McKenzie, and Justin Houston.

keyFacts: The document is a service request from the Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) for the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York at 150 Park Row.
The request, dated November 13, 2019, was to physically relocate recorders and AMS (Automated Monitoring Systems) and change their IP addresses.
The work was assigned to Signet Technologies technicians Jeff Cranor, Jeff McKenzie, and Justin Houston, with an appointment scheduled for November 15, 2019.
On November 15, technician Justin Houston indicated the systems were being shut down for the move, with reprogramming to follow.
The document is a routine technical service record, not directly referencing any individuals or events related to the Epstein case beyond the location being a federal detention facility.
